pack_name: Eastern Bihar – Health, Water & Rural Safety | पूर्वी बिहार – स्वास्थ्य, जल व ग्रामीण सुरक्षा
text: Contact numbers for Bihar divisional and district administration—Commissioner, I.G., D.I.G., D.M., and S.P.—organized by division/district.

pack_name: Eastern Bihar – Health, Water & Rural Safety | पूर्वी बिहार – स्वास्थ्य, जल व ग्रामीण सुरक्षा
text: Pesticide PPE infographic: wear long sleeves/pants, gloves, goggles, closed-toe shoes; follow label, inspect/replace PPE, and wash separately.

pack_name: Eastern Bihar – Health, Water & Rural Safety | पूर्वी बिहार – स्वास्थ्य, जल व ग्रामीण सुरक्षा
text: Map of Bihar’s protected areas—national parks, tiger reserves, wildlife sanctuaries, and the Kanwar Taal Ramsar site—overlaid on the river network.

pack_name: Eastern Bihar – Health, Water & Rural Safety | पूर्वी बिहार – स्वास्थ्य, जल व ग्रामीण सुरक्षा
text: Fauna reference for Valmiki National Park: Bengal tiger, Indian rhinoceros, Indian leopard, gaur, Asian black bear, Indian elephant, spotted deer, and sambar.

pack_name: Eastern Bihar – Health, Water & Rural Safety | पूर्वी बिहार – स्वास्थ्य, जल व ग्रामीण सुरक्षा
text: Fever in babies/children decision flowchart: when to seek emergency care, when to call for advice, and home care steps (fluids, comfortable room temp, light clothing, simple pain relief).

pack_name: Eastern Bihar – Health, Water & Rural Safety | पूर्वी बिहार – स्वास्थ्य, जल व ग्रामीण सुरक्षा
text: Infographic on relieving diarrhoea: sip fluids frequently, eat light meals, consider antidiarrheals, and investigate underlying causes; seek medical advice if symptoms persist.

pack_name: Eastern Bihar – Health, Water & Rural Safety | पूर्वी बिहार – स्वास्थ्य, जल व ग्रामीण सुरक्षा
text: Heat exhaustion vs heat stroke: key differences and immediate actions—move to a cooler place, loosen clothing, hydrate/cool; for heat stroke, treat as an emergency and call local emergency services.

pack_name: Eastern Bihar – Health, Water & Rural Safety | पूर्वी बिहार – स्वास्थ्य, जल व ग्रामीण सुरक्षा
text: Post-traumatic arthritis overview: symptoms (pain, swelling, limited motion, difficulty weight-bearing) and common treatments (pain relief, physical therapy, bracing, weight management).

pack_name: Eastern Bihar – Health, Water & Rural Safety | पूर्वी बिहार – स्वास्थ्य, जल व ग्रामीण सुरक्षा
text: Shingles (herpes zoster) guide showing symptoms like tingling, burning pain, itching, fatigue, light sensitivity, headache, and rash; notes antivirals early, pain relief options, and vaccination.

pack_name: Eastern Bihar – Health, Water & Rural Safety | पूर्वी बिहार – स्वास्थ्य, जल व ग्रामीण सुरक्षा
text: External bleeding first aid: ensure safety, assess severity, call for help, elevate, apply direct pressure 10–15 min, use tourniquet only as last resort, dress/bandage, monitor for shock.

pack_name: Eastern Bihar – Health, Water & Rural Safety | पूर्वी बिहार – स्वास्थ्य, जल व ग्रामीण सुरक्षा
text: Broken arm first aid: call emergency services, do not move the limb, apply a simple splint, use ice packs, and seek medical care.

pack_name: Eastern Bihar – Health, Water & Rural Safety | पूर्वी बिहार – स्वास्थ्य, जल व ग्रामीण सुरक्षा
text: Burn degrees side-by-side: first (redness), second (blisters), third (deep tissue damage); shows affected skin layers—epidermis, dermis, subcutaneous.

pack_name: Eastern Bihar – Health, Water & Rural Safety | पूर्वी बिहार – स्वास्थ्य, जल व ग्रामीण सुरक्षा
text: Adult choking response (‘five and five’): give five back blows followed by five abdominal thrusts; repeat until object clears or help arrives.

pack_name: Eastern Bihar – Health, Water & Rural Safety | पूर्वी बिहार – स्वास्थ्य, जल व ग्रामीण सुरक्षा
text: Non-venomous snake identification sheet common in India (e.g., rat snake, trinket, vine, cat snake, keelbacks, rock python, sand boa, wolf snake) for awareness and avoidance.

pack_name: Eastern Bihar – Health, Water & Rural Safety | पूर्वी बिहार – स्वास्थ्य, जल व ग्रामीण सुरक्षा
text: Improvised tourniquet sequence with windlass: position above wound, tighten until bleeding stops, secure without loosening.

pack_name: Eastern Bihar – Health, Water & Rural Safety | पूर्वी बिहार – स्वास्थ्य, जल व ग्रामीण सुरक्षा
text: Pressure-immobilization bandage for limb snakebite: wrap firmly from below the bite upward, extend high, add splint, restrict movement; sling for upper limb bites.

pack_name: Eastern Bihar – Health, Water & Rural Safety | पूर्वी बिहार – स्वास्थ्य, जल व ग्रामीण सुरक्षा
text: Overview of fracture patterns: hairline, oblique (displaced/nondisplaced), linear, comminuted, spiral, segmental—quick visual recognition guide.

pack_name: Eastern Bihar – Health, Water & Rural Safety | पूर्वी बिहार – स्वास्थ्य, जल व ग्रामीण सुरक्षा
text: State map showing all district boundaries and headquarters, national/state highways, major rivers, and neighboring states—quick orientation for inter-district planning.

pack_name: Eastern Bihar – Health, Water & Rural Safety | पूर्वी बिहार – स्वास्थ्य, जल व ग्रामीण सुरक्षा
text: Bihar railway network map highlighting main lines, junctions, and state capital (Patna)—useful for evacuation and relief logistics by rail.

pack_name: Eastern Bihar – Health, Water & Rural Safety | पूर्वी बिहार – स्वास्थ्य, जल व ग्रामीण सुरक्षा
text: Detailed transport map with national/state highways, district/taluk HQs, other roads, and rail overlays—supports route selection and access checks.

pack_name: Eastern Bihar – Health, Water & Rural Safety | पूर्वी बिहार – स्वास्थ्य, जल व ग्रामीण सुरक्षा
text: District-level rainfall status map with legend (no, scanty, deficient, normal, excess) and Kosi River overlay—useful for flood/drought risk awareness.

pack_name: Eastern Bihar – Health, Water & Rural Safety | पूर्वी बिहार – स्वास्थ्य, जल व ग्रामीण सुरक्षा
text: Bihar river network over district boundaries (e.g., Ganga, Son, Gandak, Kosi) for planning around floodplains, crossings, and water access.

pack_name: Eastern Bihar – Health, Water & Rural Safety | पूर्वी बिहार – स्वास्थ्य, जल व ग्रामीण सुरक्षा
text: Groundwater quality status showing contamination hotspots—arsenic (>50 ppb), fluoride (>1.5 mg/L), and iron (>1 mg/L)—across Bihar districts.
